page.title: 08All Saints Brightwalton
page.content: {All Saints Church Brightwalton}is of the{Church of England}denomination. It is of{fairly recent construction {(c.1850)}in the{Victorian Gothic}style It replaced a{Saxon Church}which was demolished,on a site adjacent to{Manor {Farm.}The{former grave yard}still remains with some old graves{extant. The{new church}has a{spire}and a{peal {of 6 bells.}The{organ}which has recently been{restored}has{two manuals and a{pedal}keyboard.It is situated in a small{trancept}on the{north}side of the church which also{doubles}as the {vestry.The font}is by the main door on the{south side}at the{west end}of the {side aisle,}this area also{doubles}as {the belfry}as this is where the ropes hang.
